newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU grain export commitments down on last year.
newsitem.headline: EU grain export commitments down on last year.

text.p: Latest European Union figures show grain export commitments between July 1 and October 29 were 10.4 percent below their year-ago level, mostly the result of a sharp decline in wheat sales, member-country officials said on Monday.
The figures, based on delivered export certificates, showed commercial wheat exports sharply lagging on last year at 2.464 million tonnes against 3.453 million.
Flour export commitments reached 1.803 million tonnes down from 2.122 million during the same period last year.
Commercial barley exports, however, jumped to 1.994 million tonnes from 885,000 during the same period last year, helped by sales to Saudi Arabia.
Malt exports fell to 1.483 million tonnes from 1.907 million tonnes.
Commercial oat commitments reached 183,000 tonnes. The EU made no oat sales during the same period last year.
Since October 29, the EU has granted 233,700 tonnes of soft wheat, 1,000 tonnes of barley and 14,716 tonnes of rye exports through its weekly grain tender system.
